name: Darius Jones
description:
'''Darius Jones''' (born May 3, 1978) is an American saxophonist, composer, and professor of [[African-American music]].

Jones has been recognized for work ranging from solo saxophone to chamber and vocal ensembles, with musical interests including [[Black music]], [[avant garde music]], and [[experimental music]]. His compositions and recordings have been included in best-of lists in publications including [[NPR Music]], [[The Wire (magazine)|''The Wire'']], and ''[[PopMatters]]'', and his live performances have been acknowledged as among the year's best in  ''[[The New York Times]]''.

In 2024, Jones was announced as incoming Assistant Professor of Music at [[Wesleyan University]].
